quotes.value: Elegance is not a dispensable luxury but a quality that decides between success and failure.
An algorithm must be seen to be believed.
Science is what we understand well enough to explain to a computer. Art is everything else we do.
Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
When someone says: 'I want a programming language in which I need only say what I wish done', give him a lollipop.
Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until itâ€™s too late.
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
Copy and paste is a design error.
Any code of your own that you haven't looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
